metadata.titel_preek: The Living God More Than “Tastes Great ... Less Filling”

locutie.beschrijving: A comparison between conservative (priestly/atonement) and progressive (justice/social) views of the gospel, synthesized through the 'Living God' who commands both love for God and neighbor.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. Uses the priestly metaphors of Hebrews and the socio-political categories of Psalm 146 to create a theological tension.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting theological categories and describing the church's conflict, shifting late to commanding and inviting.
voorbeelden: The Psalm exhibits God as the one who is transforming the political economy.
I have a word of summons to speak to you today.
Give it up for a gift from the living God.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To move the hearer from partisan slogans to a unified worship of the 'Living God' and a posture of reception.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Moderate. Mentions the 'life-giving spirit' as a carrier of power, but the sermon's mechanics rely heavily on the preacher's 'imagining'.

voorbeelden: The rhetoric is metaphorical, but the claim is serious.
Progressives believe that our faith is all about transformative justice.
Give it up for a gift from the living God.
Imagine the whole company of the church.
I do not think I overstate the tension.
This God... daily sustains the world.
The Easter God is for us and with us.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Weak. The promises are mostly stated as general theological facts (Assertives) rather than direct divine commitments to the hearer.

voorbeelden: I have a word of summons to speak to you today.
declaratieven.autoriteit: Low. The preacher 'has a word' but stops short of 'I declare you forgiven' or 'I pronounce you free'.

indicatoren: Extensive use of 'On the one hand... on the other hand'.
Talking about what conservatives and progressives believe.
Describing the beer commercial as a metaphor for the church.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes an observer of a theological debate rather than a participant in a divine encounter.

missende_elementen: Direct promise of grace to the specific 'you'

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Indirect. Stated as general truths about God rather than specific promises to the congregation.
voorbeelden: The Easter God is for us and with us.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Homiletical 'I' (I puzzled, I imagined) and inclusive 'we'.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address appears only in the final third of the sermon.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used for imperatives (Give it up) rather than commissives.

verleden_tijd.gebruik: Biblical history and the beer commercial anecdote.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Describing theological positions and God's general nature.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (Analysis of church conflict) -> Directive (Give it up/Imagine).
voorbeelden: So I have a word of summons... give it up.
foutief_patroon.probleem: The command (Directive) is not sufficiently preceded by a specific promise (Commissive) or act of grace (Declarative) addressed to the hearer.

voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: If you think... you can make yourself safe... give it up.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions as a brilliant sociological and theological commentary on church polarization but remains 'talking about' the gospel rather than 'doing' the gospel.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The synthesis of Hebrews 9 and Psalm 146.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The sermon describes God's self-giving but rarely gives God's self to the hearer.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It is an 'event' of insight, but not necessarily a sacramental 'event' of encounter.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: Lacks the 'Toezegging' (Promise) that binds God to the hearer in the present moment.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: No. God is the object of the preacher's description.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Weak. The preacher speaks as an observer/puzzler.

tekstueel_bewijs: Imagine the whole company of the church...

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Minimal. The sermon is a 'witness to' rather than a 'means of'.
tekstueel_bewijs: The Bible... is a witness to the life-giving power.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The letter to the Hebrews asserts that the self-giving of God can purify our conscience.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: By the blood of Christ, I declare your conscience purified from every dead work.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a theological possibility to a present reality.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is buried in the third person.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Address the hearer directly with God's commitment.
voorbeeldzinnen: To you who are hungry, God promises: I will feed you.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Too much time spent on 'Conservatives' and 'Progressives' as third parties.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Address the congregation as the people of God immediately.
voorbeeldzinnen: You are the children of the living God.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The 'summons' feels like a new burden because it isn't clearly the fruit of a preceding declarative.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Declare the gift before commanding the 'giving up'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is intellectually stimulating and exegetically sound, but it needs to cross the threshold from 'talking about God' to 'speaking for God'.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' (puzzling); SAT focuses on the lack of 'Declarative' force to change the hearer's status.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetorically, the beer commercial is a great 'hook', but illocutionarily, it keeps the sermon in the realm of analogy rather than epiphany.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that despite the 'summons' at the end, the sermon remains 85% constative, failing the 'sacramental event' test.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: The Psalm exhibits God as the one who is transforming the political economy.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Low - keeps God as an object of study.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: Give it up for a gift from the living God.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Moderate - lacks the preceding declarative 'The gift is yours'.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'Theological Lecture' disguised as 'Proclamation'. The shift to the second person happens too late to overcome the descriptive weight of the first two-thirds.
